summary: How I fixed my mod saturation problem. Some modes are great but I wish a few would not change Skyrims defaults. This is a document on how you can fix it like I fixed mine.
descriptionHtml:
How I fixed my mod saturation problem. Some modes are great but I wish a few would
not change Skyrims defaults. This is a document on how you can fix it like I fixed
mine.

Because some modes play with the saturations and colors of Skyrim this will restore
it back.
===========================================================
How to restore Skyrims default saturation into a mode.

1. Copy Skyrim.esm from your data folder to another folder thats safe to work on.
NOTE: Make sure its a copy and not a move.

2. Rename the Skyrim.esm to Skyrim.esp.
NOTE: You must be able to see file extensions to do this part.

3. Download TESVSnip from their web site.
https://code.google.com/p/tesv-snip/downloads/list
NOTE: This link was good last time I checked.
(updated link but if broken a web search should find it.)

4. Run TESVSnip after uncompressing and load the Skyrim.esp file.
NOTE: It will take a while to load so be patient.

5. Open the plus next to the Skyrim.esp and several groups will show.

6. The group we want to save is the IMGS group since it has all the default
saturation and other color settings.

7, Delete all other groups but the IMGS group.
NOTE: Select and delete key removes them after comfirmation.

8. After deleting all but the IMGS group you can now save file as

Default_Saturation.esp or whatever is easy for you to remember.
NOTE: Do not use the 'save' ... rename the file to be safe.

9, Copy back into the Skyrim data folder the file you created. Run Skyrim. To use make sure this file is
last in your load order list.


Saturation and color is back to skyrim normal.

You can do this for other parts of Skyrim to restore defaults.
author: cteakell
